channel.title: Lemhi County|Idaho|United States on Roadsign Pictures
channel.description: Recent content in Lemhi County|Idaho|United States on Roadsign Pictures

item.title: US-93 South - 45th Parallel
item.description: US-93 South - 45th Parallel - Halfway Between Equator and North Pole.

item.title: US-93 South at ID-28
item.description: US-93 south at ID-28 in Salmon. Turn right to continue south on US-93 to Challis and Sun Valley. Continue straight on Main St. for ID-28 South to Leadore and Idaho Falls.

item.title: US-93 South/To ID-28 - Main St. Jct.
item.description: US-93 South/To ID-28 at Main St. in Salmon. Turn left on Main St. to continue south on US-93 and for ID-28.

item.title: US-93 South/To ID-28 - Salmon
item.description: US-93 South/To ID-28 at Main St. in Salmon

item.title: US-93 South - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on US-93 south. Distance to Carmen, Salmon, and Sun Valley.

item.title: US-93 South - Salmon River Scenic Byway
item.description: US-93 South - Salmon River Scenic Byway in Lemhi County.

item.title: US-93 South - Lemhi County
item.description: Entering Lemhi County on US-93 south. Taken at the Idaho-Montana State Line at Lost Trail Pass.

item.title: US-93 South - Welcome To Idaho
item.description: Welcome to Idaho on US-93 South at Lost Trail Pass.

item.title: MT-43 West Approaching US-93
item.description: MT-43 West approaching US-93. This small stretch of MT-43 between Chief Joseph Pass and Lost Trail Pass is actually in Idaho. There are no markers or other signs that indicate this stretch of highway is in Idaho.

item.title: US-93 North Approaching MT-43 Junction
item.description: US-93 North approaching MT-43 Junction. The MT-43/US-93 intersection is at the top of Lost Trail Pass on the stateline with Idaho and Montana.

item.title: US-93 North - Gibbonsville
item.description: Entering Gibbonsville on US-93 north.

item.title: US-93 North - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on US-93 north. Distance to Gibbonsville, Jct. Mont. 43 (at Lost Trail Pass), and Missoula (Montana).

item.title: US-93 North - Shoup Jct.
item.description: US-93 north at Salmon River Road Jct. to Shoup. The Salmon River heads west here.

item.title: US-93 North - North Fork Salmon River
item.description: US-93 North at North Fork Salmon River bridge.

item.title: US-93 North - North Fork
item.description: Entering North Fork on US-93 north.

item.title: US-93 North - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on US-93 north. Distance to Carmen, North Fork, and Missoula (Montana).

item.title: US-93 North - Salmon
item.description: US-93 North in Salmon. Turn right to continue north on US-93 towards Missoula (Montana).

item.title: US-93 North at ID-28
item.description: US-93 North at ID-28 south to Leadore. Turn left to continue north on US-93 to Hamilton (MT) and Missoula (MT).

item.title: ID-29 West - Bannock Pass - Idaho State Line
item.description: Idaho State Line on ID-29 west at Bannock Pass - Elevation 7672 Feet. Bannock Pass is on the Continental Divide located on the Idaho-Montana border.

item.title: ID-29 - Pavement Ends
item.description: Pavement Ends on ID-29 east. ID-29 is one of two state highways in Idaho (the other is ID-64) that has segments that are not paved.

item.title: ID-29 East - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on ID-29 east. Distance to Clark Canyon Dam (I-15 Jct. in Montana) and Dillon (Montana).

item.title: ID-28 South at ID-29
item.description: ID-28 south at ID-29 east to Dillon (Montana). Continue south on ID-28 for Rexburg and Idaho Falls.

item.title: ID-28 South Approaching ID-29
item.description: ID-28 South approaching ID-29 in Leadore.

item.title: ID-28 South - Leadore
item.description: Entering Leadore - Population 105 on ID-28 south.

item.title: ID-28 South - 45th Parallel
item.description: ID-28 South - 45th Parallel - Halfway Between The Equator and North Pole.

item.title: ID-28 South - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance marker on ID-28 south in Salmon. Distance to Baker, Tendoy, and Idaho Falls.

item.title: ID-28 South - Sacajawea Historic Byway
item.description: Sacajawea Historic Byway on ID-28 South in Salmon.

item.title: US-93 North at ID-28
item.description: US-93 North at ID-28 south to Leadore. Turn left to continue north on US-93 to Hamilton (MT) and Missoula (MT).

item.title: US-93 North Approaching ID-28
item.description: US-93 North approaching ID-28 in Salmon. Turn left to continue north on US-93; right for ID-28 south.

item.title: US-93 North - Entering Salmon
item.description: Entering Salmon - Population 3,112 on US-93 north. Salmon is the county seat of Lemhi County.

item.title: ID-28 North - Sacajawea Historic Byway
item.description: Sacajawea Scenic Byway on ID-28 north.

item.title: End ID-29 at ID-28
item.description: End of ID-29 at ID-28 Junction. Lemhi Range in background.

item.title: ID-28 North at ID-29
item.description: ID-28 North at ID-29 Junction to Dillon,MT in

item.title: ID-29 - Bannock Pass - ID/MT Border
item.description: Bannock Pass at end of ID-29 on ID-MT Border

item.title: ID-29 East
item.description: ID-29 Shield, Lemhi County. ID-29 is one of two gravel highways in Idaho (the other is ID-64).

item.title: ID-29 West - Distance Marker
item.description: Distance To Leadore and Salmon, ID-29 on Bannock Pass

item.title: US-93 North - Lemhi County/Pahsimeroi River
item.description: US-93 North Entering Lemhi County at the Pahsimeroi River

item.description: Welcome To Idaho/Salmon National Forest at Lost Trail Pass

item.title: US-93 in Salmon
